intro: Calymmanthera tenuis, commonly known as the slender calymmanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow to orange flowers. Calymmanthera tenuis is often found in regions with temperate climates and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-rich soils.
